title: First Indochina War
summary: The First Indochina War (generally known as the Indochina War in France, and as the Anti-French Resistance War in Vietnam) began in French Indochina on December 19, 1946, and lasted until July 20, 1954. Fighting between French forces and their Việt Minh opponents in the south dated from September 1945. The conflict pitted a range of forces, including the French Union's French Far East Expeditionary Corps, led by the government of France and supported by the former emperor Bảo Đại's Vietnamese National Army against the People's Army of Vietnam and Việt Minh (part of the Communist Party),[27] led by Võ Nguyên Giáp and Hồ Chí Minh.[28][29] Most of the fighting took place in Tonkin in northern Vietnam,[30] although the conflict engulfed the entire country and also extended into the neighboring French Indochina protectorates of Laos and Cambodia.
